attributes.title: Southwest Chicken & Bacon Cobb Salad
attributes.description: This twist on a Cobb salad takes all your favorite elements of the classic dish—crispy bacon, juicy chicken, creamy avocado, tangy blue cheese—and gives them a Southwestern spin thanks to additions like guacamole and crunchy blue corn tortilla chips. Toss everything with grape tomatoes and crisp baby lettuce, and you’re set!
attributes.equipment:
Large Pan
Paper Towel
Small Bowl
Large Bowl
attributes.instructions:
1. • Heat a large dry pan over medium- high heat. Add bacon*; cook, turning occasionally and adjusting heat if browning too quickly, until crispy, 6-10 minutes. • Turn off heat; transfer to a paper-towel- lined plate. Reserve bacon fat in a small heatproof bowl and carefully wipe out any burnt bits from pan.
2. • While bacon cooks, wash and dry produce. • Dry lettuce thoroughly. Trim and discard root end; chop leaves into bite-size pieces. Halve tomatoes. Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens.
3. • Once bacon is done, pat chicken* dry with paper towels and season all over with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. • Heat reserved bacon fat and a drizzle of oil in pan used for bacon over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side.  • Transfer chicken to a cutting board to rest.
4. • Meanwhile, in a large bowl, add lettuce, tomatoes, scallion whites, and dressing. Toss until thoroughly combined.
5. • Roughly chop bacon. Thinly slice chicken crosswise.
6. • Divide salad between shallow bowls. Arrange chicken over center of each salad, then top with bacon, a dollop of guacamole, and scallion greens. Sprinkle as many chips (crushing in the bag first) as you like around chicken and serve.
attributes.author: HelloFresh
attributes.notes: If chicken starts to brown too quickly, reduce heat and cover.

attributes.title: One-Pan Tilapia with Red Beans & Kale
attributes.description: Simple, streamlined, and packed with veggies, this one-pan tilapia dinner is the perfect dish for busy weeknights. Gently steaming the tilapia over a simmering bed of tomato, kidney beans, and kale ensures the fish stays perfectly flaky and tender. Finish it off with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice to bring out this meal’s bright flavors.
attributes.instructions:
1. • Wash and dry produce. • Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Dice tomato into 1⁄2-inch pieces. Drain and rinse beans. Remove and discard any large stems from kale. Quarter lemon.
2. • Pat tilapia* dry with paper towels; season generously all over with salt and pepper. • Set aside until ready to use.
3. • Heat a large drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 3-5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 30-60 seconds. • Add tomato, beans, stock concentrates, 1⁄4 cup water, and 2 TBSP butter (1⁄2 cup water and 4 TBSP butter for 4 servings). Stir to combine. Bring to a simmer.
4. • Once beans, veggies, and broth are simmering, add kale. Cover pan with lid. Cook, stirring occasionally, until kale has wilted, 2-3 minutes. • Taste and season with salt and pepper.
5. • Place tilapia over beans and kale. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover pan with lid; simmer until fish is cooked through and easily flakes with a fork, 8-10 minutes more.
6. • Squeeze juice from one lemon wedge (two wedges for 4 servings) over tilapia. • Divide tilapia and red beans and kale between plates; serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
attributes.author: HelloFresh

attributes.title: Peruvian-Style Lomo Saltado
attributes.description: This Peruvian-inspired spread is sure to delight. First, there’s lomo saltado, a savory steak stir-fry that combines tomato, onion, and soy sauce, which is served alongside crispy roasted potatoes. Then, you’ll bake up crispy chicken empanadas paired with a creamy, cool chimichurri for dipping. Fluffy, buttery rice completes the feast!
attributes.equipment:
Baking Sheet
Small pot
Paper Towel
Medium Bowl
Large Pan
Small Bowl
Whisk
attributes.instructions:
1. • Adjust rack to top position (top and middle positions for 4 servings) and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. • Cut potatoes into 1⁄2-inch-thick wedges. Toss on one side of a baking sheet with a drizzle of oil, oregano, half the garlic powder (you’ll use the rest later), salt, and pepper (for 4, spread potatoes across entire sheet). Roast on top rack for 10 minutes (you’ll add more to the sheet then). • Once potatoes have roasted 10 minutes, remove sheet from oven. Lightly oil opposite side of baking sheet; add empanadas. Bake on top rack, flipping empanadas halfway through, until empanadas are golden brown and potatoes are browned and tender, 15-18 minutes more. (For 4, leave potatoes roasting; place empanadas on a second lightly oiled baking sheet and bake on middle rack.)
2. • Halve, peel, and cut half the onion (whole onion for 4 servings) into 1⁄2-inch wedges. Cut tomato into 1⁄2-inch wedges. Roughly chop cilantro. • In a small pot, combine rice, 3⁄4 cup water (1 1⁄2 cups for 4), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes. • Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
3. • Pat steak* dry with paper towels; slice into 1-by-3-inch strips (the strips don’t need to be perfect—a rough 1 by 3 inches is fine!). • In a medium bowl, combine cornstarch, half the cumin (all for 4 servings), remaining garlic powder, salt, and pepper. • Add steak; toss until thoroughly coated.
4. • Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add steak and cook, tossing occasionally, until a crust forms, 4-6 minutes (the steak will finish cooking in the next step). Turn off heat; transfer to a plate. Wipe out pan.
5. • Heat another drizzle of oil in pan used for steak over medium heat. Add onion wedges and tomato; cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly tender, 4-6 minutes. • Add steak, soy sauce, Sriracha, 1/3 cup water, 2 tsp vinegar, and 1⁄4 tsp sugar (2/3 cup water, 4 tsp vinegar, and 1⁄2 tsp sugar for 4 servings). (Reserve remaining vinegar for another use.) Cook, stirring, until sauce has thickened and steak is cooked through, 1-3 minutes. Taste and season with salt and pepper if desired.
6. • In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and chimichurri. Season with salt and pepper if desired.
7. • Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 1 TBSP butter (2 TBSP for 4 servings). Garnish with half the cilantro. • Place potatoes on a serving dish; top with lomo saltado. Garnish with remaining cilantro. • Serve rice, potatoes and lomo saltado, and empanadas family style. Serve with creamy chimichurri sauce on the side.
attributes.author: HelloFresh

attributes.title: Ready-Made Meal: Signature Favorites Variety Pack
attributes.description:
Wholesome, quick, and delicious meals that are ready when you need ’em—that’s what our Ready-Made Meals are all about. Can’t decide which one to choose? This variety pack of customer faves has you covered! Try the butter chicken with rice and our savory tomatillo pulled pork. There’s also a creamy alfredo truffle cavatappi pasta and our classic beef bolognese. And the best part? These are all ready to eat after a quick spin in the microwave. (Oh, and no pots or pans to clean!) I 1 tray per serving.


*Nutrition values for 1 container of Alfredo Truffle Cavatappi is as follows: Calories 560, Total Fat 29g, Sat. Fat 15g, Cholest. 75mg, Sodium 830mg, Total Carb. 53g, Fiber 4g, Sugar 3g, Protein 22 g.*  

*Nutrition values for 1 container of Butter Chicken with Rice is as follows: Calories 490, Total Fat 13g, Sat. Fat 4.5g, Cholest. 50mg, Sodium 1180mg, Total Carb. 72g, Fiber 4g, Sugar 6g, Protein 21 g.*  

*Nutrition values for 1 container of Tomatillo Pulled Pork with Rice is as follows: Calories 430, Total Fat 13g, Sat. Fat 6g, Cholest. 50mg, Sodium 1070mg, Total Carb. 54g, Fiber 3g, Sugar 6g, Protein 21 g.*  

*Nutrition values for 1 container of Beef Bolognese with Rotini is as follows: Calories 400, Total Fat 14g, Sat. Fat 6g, Cholest. 45mg, Sodium 950mg, Total Carb. 48g, Fiber 5g, Sugar 6g, Protein 17 g.*
attributes.author: HelloFresh

attributes.title: Mild Salsa
attributes.description:
Who doesn’t love salsa? We certainly do! In ours, diced tomatoes and onions help create a flavorful base that’s brightened up with lime juice plus a touch of cilantro and jalapeño for a mild kick. Serve this easy-to-love dip with tortilla chips for a no-effort appetizer at your next gathering, add it to breakfast burritos for an elevated morning meal, or drizzle it over a tray of nachos. The options are endless!


*Nutrition values are representative of a 2 TBSP serving.*
attributes.author: HelloFresh

attributes.title: Guacamole & Blue Corn Tortilla Chip Combo
attributes.description: Who doesn’t love chips and guac? We certainly do! With this duo, you’ll get 8 ounces of our classic guacamole, featuring avocado mashed to creamy perfection, lime juice, diced tomato and onion, and jalapeño purée for a little kick (that’s right, no cilantro!). To complete this easy snack or app, you’ll also get wholesome blue corn tortilla chips—a perfectly crisp and crunchy complement to this cool, creamy dip!
attributes.author: HelloFresh

attributes.title: Guacamole, Mild Salsa & Blue Corn Tortilla Chip Combo

With this trifecta, you’ll get 8 ounces of our classic guacamole—featuring avocado mashed to creamy perfection, lime juice, diced tomato and onion, and jalapeño purée—along with 12 ounces of our mild, tomato-forward salsa. To complete this easy snack or app, you’ll also get wholesome blue corn tortilla chips—a perfectly crisp and crunchy complement to both dips!

attributes.title: Coconut Curry Tofu with Bok Choy
attributes.description:
Wholesome, quick, and delicious meals that are ready when you need ’em—that’s what our Ready-Made Meals are all about. For this vegetarian dish, tender pasta is tossed with fire-roasted peppers and onions, earthy kale, bok choy, and tofu, then smothered in a creamy coconut curry sauce. The best part? It’s ready to eat after a quick spin in the microwave (and no pots or pans to clean!). | 1 tray per serving.


*Ingredients: cooked enriched spaghetti pasta (WHEAT), Thai-style yellow sauce (COCONUT), fried tofu pieces (SOY), onion and pepper blend, kale, bok choy.*

ingredient.name: Coconut Curry Tofu with Bok Choy

attributes.author: HelloFresh
